<a id="ZIPPacker"></a>

# ZIPPacker

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Allows the creation of ZIP files.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

This class implements a writer that allows storing the multiple blobs in a ZIP archive. See also [ZIPReader](ZIPReader.md) and [PCKPacker](PCKPacker.md).

```
    # Create a ZIP archive with a single file at its root.
    func write_zip_file():
        var writer = ZIPPacker.new()
        var err = writer.open("user://archive.zip")
        if err != OK:
            return err
        writer.start_file("hello.txt")
        writer.write_file("Hello World".to_utf8_buffer())
        writer.close_file()

        writer.close()
        return OK
```

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_ZIPPacker_ZipAppend"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **ZipAppend**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_ZIPPacker_ZipAppend)

<a id="ZIPPacker_constant_APPEND_CREATE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ZipAppend](ZIPPacker.md#enum_ZIPPacker_ZipAppend) **APPEND_CREATE** = `0`

Create a new zip archive at the given path.<a id="ZIPPacker_constant_APPEND_CREATEAFTER"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ZipAppend](ZIPPacker.md#enum_ZIPPacker_ZipAppend) **APPEND_CREATEAFTER** = `1`

Append a new zip archive to the end of the already existing file at the given path.<a id="ZIPPacker_constant_APPEND_ADDINZIP"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ZipAppend](ZIPPacker.md#enum_ZIPPacker_ZipAppend) **APPEND_ADDINZIP** = `2`

Add new files to the existing zip archive at the given path.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_ZIPPacker_CompressionLevel"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **CompressionLevel**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_ZIPPacker_CompressionLevel)

<a id="ZIPPacker_constant_COMPRESSION_DEFAULT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[CompressionLevel](ZIPPacker.md#enum_ZIPPacker_CompressionLevel) **COMPRESSION_DEFAULT** = `-1`

Start a file with the default Deflate compression level (``6``). This is a good compromise between speed and file size.<a id="ZIPPacker_constant_COMPRESSION_NONE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[CompressionLevel](ZIPPacker.md#enum_ZIPPacker_CompressionLevel) **COMPRESSION_NONE** = `0`

Start a file with no compression. This is also known as the "Store" compression mode and is the fastest method of packing files inside a ZIP archive. Consider using this mode for files that are already compressed (such as JPEG, PNG, MP3, or Ogg Vorbis files).<a id="ZIPPacker_constant_COMPRESSION_FAST"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[CompressionLevel](ZIPPacker.md#enum_ZIPPacker_CompressionLevel) **COMPRESSION_FAST** = `1`

Start a file with the fastest Deflate compression level (``1``). This is fast to compress, but results in larger file sizes than [COMPRESSION_DEFAULT](ZIPPacker.md#ZIPPacker_constant_COMPRESSION_DEFAULT). Decompression speed is generally unaffected by the chosen compression level.<a id="ZIPPacker_constant_COMPRESSION_BEST"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[CompressionLevel](ZIPPacker.md#enum_ZIPPacker_CompressionLevel) **COMPRESSION_BEST** = `9`

Start a file with the best Deflate compression level (``9``). This is slow to compress, but results in smaller file sizes than [COMPRESSION_DEFAULT](ZIPPacker.md#ZIPPacker_constant_COMPRESSION_DEFAULT). Decompression speed is generally unaffected by the chosen compression level.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="ZIPPacker_property_compression_level"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **compression_level** = `-1` [ðŸ”—](#ZIPPacker_property_compression_level)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_compression_level**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_compression_level**\ (\ )

The compression level used when [start_file()](ZIPPacker.md#ZIPPacker_method_start_file) is called. Use [CompressionLevel](ZIPPacker.md#enum_ZIPPacker_CompressionLevel) as a reference.

## Method Descriptions

<a id="ZIPPacker_method_close"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **close**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ZIPPacker_method_close)

Closes the underlying resources used by this instance.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ZIPPacker_method_close_file"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **close_file**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ZIPPacker_method_close_file)

Stops writing to a file within the archive.

It will fail if there is no open file.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ZIPPacker_method_open"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **open**\ (\ path\: [String](String.md), append\: [ZipAppend](ZIPPacker.md#enum_ZIPPacker_ZipAppend) = 0\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ZIPPacker_method_open)

Opens a zip file for writing at the given path using the specified write mode.

This must be called before everything else.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ZIPPacker_method_start_file"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **start_file**\ (\ path\: [String](String.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ZIPPacker_method_start_file)

Starts writing to a file within the archive. Only one file can be written at the same time.

Must be called after [open()](ZIPPacker.md#ZIPPacker_method_open).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="ZIPPacker_method_write_file"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **write_file**\ (\ data\: [PackedByteArray](PackedByteArray.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#ZIPPacker_method_write_file)

Write the given `data` to the file.

Needs to be called after [start_file()](ZIPPacker.md#ZIPPacker_method_start_file).
